mesa 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Fit the GLM and return the data

    calculateDMRs.Rd

    This function fits a GLM and returns the resulting data table

    calculateDMRs(
  qseaSet,
  variable = NULL,
  sampleNames = NULL,
  covariates = NULL,
  contrastsToDo = NULL,
  minReadCount = 0,
  minNRPM = 1,
  checkPVals = TRUE,
  fdrThres = 0.05,
  keepPvals = FALSE,
  formula = NULL,
  keepData = FALSE,
  keepGroupMeans = FALSE,
  direction = "both"
)

    Arguments

    qseaSet

    The qseaSet object

    variable

    Which variable to use to calculate the DMRs between

    sampleNames

    Which samples to return the information for.

    covariates

    Any variables to use as covariates, for instance patient in a paired analysis

    contrastsToDo

    A data frame with two columns, sample1 and sample2, with the strings to compare between in each. Multiple rows means that multiple comparisons will be fitted

    minReadCount

    A minimum read count that at least one sample (in the contrasts) must reach in order to consider the region for further calculation. Preferably use minNRPM.

    minNRPM

    A minimum normalised reads per million value that at least one sample (in the contrasts) must reach in order to consider the region for further calculation. Set this or minReadCount (but preferably this).

    checkPVals

    Whether to check that the p-values aren't all zero to avoid a bug with covariates, only turn this off if you are very sure what you are doing!

    fdrThres

    False discovery rate threshold.

    keepPvals

    Whether to keep the unadjusted p-values in the output

    formula

    Alternative formula mode for calculating DMRs (not recommended)

    keepData

    Whether to keep the individual data columns in the output

    keepGroupMeans

    Whether to keep the group means in the output

    direction

    Whether to keep regions that are up/down/both.

    Value

    A tibble with the data

    Contents
